News and developments from Justia and the tech world -----
November 2019

Welcome to the November 2019 edition 
of the Justia client newsletter!

Get the latest scoop on online marketing, read our digest of legal and SEO news from the past month, and peek inside the doors at Justia to see what our team has been doing.

Featured News

Is Your New Website Haunted by the Ghosts of Your Old One?

Your new website looks great, but is it haunted? Is your old website which you thought was dead tormenting your new site from beyond the grave? In this Halloween post, we talk about ways your old website can actually harm your SEO efforts on your new website, and what you can do about it.
Read More

Tip of the Month

Justia Lawyer Directory Now Publishing Client Reviews

We are excited to announce that the Justia Lawyer Directory is now publishing client reviews. Together with the existing attorney peer ratings, these two critical points of view can inform consumers on an attorney's legal abilities as well as how well they communicate with their clients.

Getting online reviews can really boost your business. Take this opportunity to reach out to your clients, thank them for their business and encourage them to post a review on your profile.
Learn More about Client Reviews

Tech News

Washington State Keeps Enforcing Net Neutrality as it Hails FCC Court Loss

Following an appellate court decision to vacate the FCC’s attempt to preempt state net neutrality laws, Washington is still enforcing its 2018 net neutrality statute.

Tech Giants Shift Profits to Avoid Taxes. There’s a Plan to Stop Them.

The Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development has proposed a system for allowing countries to tax large international corporations doing business outside their borders.

FBI Misused Surveillance Data, Spied on Its Own, FISA Ruling Finds

A US Foreign Intelligence Service Act court ruling from October 2018 indicates that FBI employees improperly used data to research colleagues and family members.

Apple Removes App Used in Hong Kong Protests After Pressure From China

A crowdsourced mapping app popular in Hong Kong has been removed from the App Store following its reported use during pro-democracy protests taking place in that country.

hagenbroklaw.com

SEO News

Google: Ignore Link Spam Ransom Attempts

According to Google, it is not necessary to address ransom emails that threaten to spam your website with poor quality links and harm your rankings.

Google Ads Introduces 2 New Ways to Target Users in Google Search

With the launch of affinity audiences and seasonal event segments for in-market audiences, Google is offering new ways to reach parts of your target market as the holidays approach

Events We Attended

Coahuila Engineering Week

Geovanny of our engineering team presented at the State University of Coahuila for Engineering Week, on the topic of Web Scraping. He covered how we extract data from different sources and parse it for our Justia resources.

Social Media News

Yahoo Is Deleting All Content Ever Posted to Yahoo Groups

After close to 20 years of operation, Yahoo Groups is shutting down, and users have until mid-December to save any content they have posted to the site.

Zuckerberg Defends Facebook’s ‘Free Expression’ in Face of Washington Hostility

In a recent speech at Georgetown University, the Facebook CEO defended the company’s somewhat permissive stance toward seemingly misleading campaign ads.

Twitter Explains What It Would Take for Trump’s Account or Tweets to be Deleted

Twitter has outlined six areas in which transgressions by any account holder, including a political leader, can lead to account action including removal.

EU Nations Can Force Facebook to Remove Content Worldwide, Court Rules

Europe’s highest court has ruled that social media platforms must seek to identify illegal content, and must block it globally if any country’s government requests it.

Inside Justia

Meet Our Team

Showing Our Team Spirit

As is our annual tradition, we tapped into our creative side and came up with some really great costumes. Each year, we see more creativity than the last! Some were scary, others were silly, and everyone had a fun time.

A Pug’s Tale

Happy Pug-O-Ween!

Team Justia had a great time celebrating Halloween with the Hug Pugs! Check out Little Sheba and Rio in their costumes, hoping for lots of treats.

Legal Industry News

LSAT Will Change For All Would-Be Lawyers as a Result of Blind Man’s Lawsuit Settlement

Following a discrimination lawsuit from a visually impaired test taker, the LSAC will be reformulating the analytical reasoning section of the LSAT to make it accessible.

Cybersecurity, The C-Suite, & The Boardroom: The Rising Specter of Director & Officer Liability

Recent legal developments indicate that corporate directors and officers will likely begin to face a higher risk of liability related to data breaches than they once did.
